title: What is React?
answers: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
A programming language
A database management system
An operating system
right_answer: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces

title: What is JSX in React?
answers: A syntax extension for JavaScript
A separate templating language
A CSS preprocessor
A new programming language

title: What is a component in React?
answers: A reusable piece of UI that can be composed with other components to form an application
A JavaScript function
A CSS class
An HTML element
right_answer: A reusable piece of UI that can be composed with other components to form an application

title: What is state in React?
answers: A function that is used to update a component's UI
A way to define the layout of a component
An object that holds the data that defines a component's behavior
A way to define the styling of a component
right_answer: An object that holds the data that defines a component's behavior

title: What is props in React?
answers: Short for properties, it is a way to pass data from a parent component to a child component
A way to define the layout of a component
A way to define the styling of a component
A function that is used to update a component's UI
right_answer: Short for properties, it is a way to pass data from a parent component to a child component

title: What is the virtual DOM in React?
answers: A lightweight representation of the actual DOM used for performance optimization
A new version of the DOM with additional features
A way to add styles to the DOM
A way to define the structure of the DOM
right_answer: A lightweight representation of the actual DOM used for performance optimization

title: What is the React lifecycle?
answers: A way to manage the state of a component
A way to manage the props of a component
A way to manage the rendering of a component
A series of methods that are called at different stages of a component's existence
right_answer: A series of methods that are called at different stages of a component's existence

title: What is the difference between a controlled and an uncontrolled component in React?
answers: A controlled component is one where the value of the input is controlled by React, while an uncontrolled component is one where the value is controlled by the DOM
A controlled component is one that has a state, while an uncontrolled component is one that does not have a state
A controlled component is one that is managed by a parent component, while an uncontrolled component is one that is managed by itself
A controlled component is one that is used with Redux, while an uncontrolled component is one that is not used with Redux
right_answer: A controlled component is one where the value of the input is controlled by React, while an uncontrolled component is one where the value is controlled by the DOM

title: What is Redux in React?
answers: A new version of React with additional features
A way to define the structure of a component
A predictable state container for JavaScript applications
A way to manage the rendering of a component
right_answer: A predictable state container for JavaScript applications

title: What is React Router?
answers: A way to manage the state of a component
A library for handling routing in React applications
A way to manage the props of a component
A way to manage the rendering of a component
right_answer: A library for handling routing in React applications
